taskman

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • taskman.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    This class serves as a controller between the interface and the backend.
    Author:
    Alexander Braekevelt

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Controller()
      Create a controller (with minimum time and regular user type).

      Create a controller (with given time and regular user type).
      Controller(java.lang.String initialTime, java.lang.String initialUserType)
      Create a controller (with given time and given user type).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller()
        Create a controller (with minimum time and regular user type).

      • Controller

        public Controller(java.lang.String initialTime)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a controller (with given time and regular user type).
        Parameters:
        initialTime - the initial system time.
        Postcondition:
        the time of the system will be set to the given time
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the new time if before the old time.

      • Controller

        public Controller(java.lang.String initialTime,
                  java.lang.String initialUserType)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a controller (with given time and given user type).
        Parameters:
        initialTime - the initial system time.
        initialUserType - the user that will be active.
        Postconditions:
      • the time of the system will be set to the given time
      • the user type will be set to the given user type.
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the new time if before the old time.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the user type does not exist.

      • getProjectCreationForm

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getProjectCreationForm()
        This method generates a form containing all parameters needed to create a new project. All values are empty and can be filled in, and then passed back to create a project.
        Returns:
        A map containing all elements that need to be filled in to create a new project

      • addProject

        public void addProject(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> form)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a project with the properties from a given form.
        Parameters:
        form - the creation form for the project
        Postcondition:
        a project with the properties from a given form will be added to the controller.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when one of the parameters is abscent or not valid.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a project with the given name already exist

      • addAlternativeToTask

        public void addAlternativeToTask(java.lang.String projectName,
                                 java.lang.Integer taskId,
                                 java.lang.Integer alternativeTaskId)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the alternative of the given task to the given alternative task
        Parameters:
        projectName - the name of the project which holds both tasks
        taskId - the id of the task
        alternativeTaskId - the id of the alternative task
        Postcondition:
        the alternative task of the task is set to the given task
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the project does not exist.

      • addDependencyToTask

        public void addDependencyToTask(java.lang.String projectName,
                                java.lang.Integer taskId,
                                java.lang.Integer dependencyTaskId)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                java.nio.file.AccessDeniedException
        Adds the given dependency to the given task
        Parameters:
        projectName - the name of the project which holds both tasks
        taskId - the id of the task
        dependencyTaskId - the id of the dependency
        Postcondition:
        the dependency is added to the task.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the project does not exist.
        java.nio.file.AccessDeniedException - if the task is already finished or failed.

      • getUpdateTaskStatusForm

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getUpdateTaskStatusForm()
        This method generates a form containing all parameters needed to update a task status All values are empty and can be filled in, and then passed back to update a task status.
        Returns:
        A map containing all elements that need to be filled in to update a task status

      • updateTaskStatus

        public void updateTaskStatus(java.lang.String projectName,
                             java.lang.Integer taskId,
                             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> form)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                             java.nio.file.AccessDeniedException
        Updates the status of the given task.
        Parameters:
        projectName - the name of the project of the task
        taskId - the id of the task to update
        form - the HashMap containing the new values necessary to update the task status
        Postcondition:
        the start time, end time and status of the task will be updated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the project does not exist.
        java.nio.file.AccessDeniedException - if the active user type cannot edit tasks

      • getDelay

        public java.lang.String getDelay(java.lang.String projectName,
                                 java.lang.Integer taskId)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Return the delay between the end time and the estimated end time in minutes.
        Returns:
        a String with the time between the end time and the estimated end time in minutes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the task is not yet finished.

        Returns:
        the time of the system

      • updateSystemTime

        public void updateSystemTime(java.lang.String newTime)
                      throws java.time.format.DateTimeParseException,
                             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Updates the time of the system
        Parameters:
        newTime - the new time of the system
        Postcondition:
        the time of the system will be set to the given time
        Throws:
        java.time.format.DateTimeParseException - if the text cannot be parsed
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the new time if before the old time.

        Parameters:
        user - the name of the user type to change to.
        Postcondition:
